member.name: P:Enterprise.MediatR.Assemblies.MediatRAssemblyService.AssembliesToRegister
member.summary: This is a collection of assemblies that contain MediatR types. If there are no assemblies added to this collection, a fallback will be used that loads solution assemblies.

member.name: M:Enterprise.MediatR.Assemblies.MediatRAssemblyService.AddAssembly(System.Reflection.Assembly)
member.summary: Explicitly add an assembly containing MediatR types. This will be included when MediatR services are registered.

member.name: M:Enterprise.MediatR.Assemblies.MediatRAssemblyService.RemoveAssembly(System.Reflection.Assembly)
member.summary: Explicitly remove an assembly containing one or more MediatR types. This will be excluded when MediatR services are registered.

member.name: P:Enterprise.MediatR.Options.MediatROptions.EnableMediatR
member.summary: Determines if MediatR services will be registered. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:Enterprise.MediatR.Options.MediatROptions.BehaviorRegistrations
member.summary: Allows for providing a custom behavior pipeline. This will override any default behavior, so be sure to include all behaviors needed for the application in a specific order.

member.name: P:Enterprise.MediatR.Options.MediatROptions.CustomConfigure
member.summary: This allows for complete customization and control over the MediatR config. None of the default configuration is used, so everything must be completely configured.

member.name: M:Enterprise.MediatR.Options.MediatROptions.AddAssembly(System.Reflection.Assembly)
member.summary: Explicitly add an assembly containing MediatR types. This will be registered in the MediatR configuration delegates if MediatR has been enabled.
